comments.body: Why is this a  method? If it was not a method, but a simple func, it would not have to show up in upper interface.

> Why is this a method? If it was not a method, but a simple func, it would not have to show up in upper interface.

The rules for applying it are contained in the evaluator.

> see comment below about `RemoveDeletedKinds`.

Well, you're going to be exposing something, somewhere.  This is a reasonable interface based on the rest of the package.
what's the value of the abstraction via an interface?

> what's the value of the abstraction via an interface?

Encapsulation, future mocks, potentially choosing a different reason to suppress in the future.
